creator: netanelshine@gmail.com
text:
OS : (lsb_relase -a)

Distributor ID: Debian                                                                              
Description:    Debian GNU/Linux 6.0.1 (squeeze)                                                    
Release:        6.0.1                                                                               
Codename:       squeeze                                                                             
Apache Version: (apache2 -v)

Server version: Apache/2.2.16 (Debian)                                                              
Server built:   Mar 22 2011 20:56:31                                                                

The problem:
The server hangs suddenly (from time to time - without a fixed time) not responding except Ping. The only solution is to reboot the server. when entering the console I see the following output:

 DS: 007b ES: 007b FS: 00d8 GS: 0033 SS: 0069                                                       
Process apache2 (pid: 21822, ti=ea8d0000 task=c686c400 task.ti=ea8d0000)                            
Stack:

 00000000 c01a9318 da2badc8 c019ac1a 00000000 80000003 00000040 00000002

 [<c019ac1a>] ? do_swap_page+0x2ca/0x5f0

 [<c019c494>] ? handle_mm_fault+0xf4/0x1b0

 [<c0173821>] ? handle_percpu_irq+0x31/0x50

 [<c0139450>] ? __local_bh_enable+0x70/0x70

note: apache2[21822] exited with preempt_count 1

creator: covener@gmail.com
text: There's no sign of a bug in Apache HTTP Server here.  If you get some analysis from Debian or someone in the Linux kernel that the diagnostics imply some error in a httpd as opposed to the kernel or Hardware, post the analyis here and reopen.
